alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 6:25PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong northwesterly winds will impact portions of southern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northwestern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas and western Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 700 PM MDT/800 PM CDT/... At 619 PM MDT/719 PM CDT/, strong winds emanating from thunderstorms in Washington county were progressing east toward the Kansas and Nebraska border, along a line extending from 16 miles southwest of Champion to 9 miles southwest of Wray to 5 miles northeast of Cope. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and locally reduced visibilities associated with blowing dust. SOURCE...At 539 PM MDT, the automated observation site in Yuma reported sustained winds of 39 mph gusting to 48 mph with a visibility reduced to two and a half miles in association with blowing dust. At 615 PM MDT, the automated observation site in Wray reported sustained winds at 43 mph and gusts up to 52 mph with a visibility reduced to 5 miles in association with blowing dust. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions, particularly on Highway 34 in Yuma and Dundy counties. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 219 and 249. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
